intro: Pappea fulva, commonly known as the yellow karkadee, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its yellowish-green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. Pappea fulva is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
